required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Breast Cancer Detection: Comparison of Breast Tomosynthesis and Conventional Mammography
clinical_study.official_title: Breast Cancer Detection: Comparison of Breast Tomosynthesis and Conventional Mammography

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary hypothesis to be tested is:
The detection of breast cancer will be increased with tomosynthesis (3D) imaging

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if: 1 the detection of breast cancer will be increased with conventional (2D) imaging plus tomosynthesis (3D) imaging, or 2. if the the detection of breast cancer will be increased with tomosynthesis (3D) imaging alone.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to two years follow up for development of breast cancer
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity is the number of true positives (TP) divided by the sum of TP and false negatives (FN): Sensitivity = TP / (TP+FN)

arm_group.description: conventional (2D) imaging plus tomosynthesis (3D) imaging first then tomosynthesis alone 1 month later.
tomosynthesis (3D) imaging alone first then conventional (2D) imaging plus tomosyntheis 1 month later.

intervention.description: The mean glandular radiation dose for each image will be approximately 145 millirads (mrad) for a standard size breast (4.2 cm compressed breast thickness).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Any ethnic origin
- No contraindication for routine bilateral mammography
Exclusion Criteria:
Potential subjects with any of the following will not be enrolled in the study:
- Any contraindications to mammographic screening, including, but not limited to:
- Significant existing breast trauma
- Under the age of 30 at the time of consent
- Breast Implants
- Prior Surgeries
- Unable to understand and execute written informed consent
- Pregnant
- Lactating

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 496 enrolled and 426 completed study, but no information available to distinguish study arms: Conventional+Tomosynthesis First Then Tomo alone 1 mo. Later (number of participants enrolled in arm is unknown). Tomosynthesis alone First Then Conventional+Tomo 1 mo. Later (number of participants enrolled in arm is unknown).

baseline.population: 496 participants enrolled overall, but no information available to distinguish study arms: Conventional+Tomosynthesis First Then Tomo alone 1 mo. Later (number of participants enrolled in arm is unknown). Tomosynthesis alone First Then Conventional+Tomo 1 mo. Later (number of participants enrolled in arm is unknown).

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: All study participants in both arms. 496 enrolled and 426 completed study, but no information available to distinguish study arms.

outcome.title: Detection of Breast Cancer (Sensitivity)
outcome.description: Sensitivity is the number of true positives (TP) divided by the sum of TP and false negatives (FN): Sensitivity = TP / (TP+FN)
outcome.time_frame: up to two years follow up for development of breast cancer
outcome.population: PI left institution in 2012; Data remaining did not include outcome measure and adverse event data. Institution contacted PI on numerous occasions. PI also does not have data.

group.title: Conventional + Tomosynthesis First Then Tomo Alone 1 mo. Later
group.description: Tomosynthesis: The mean glandular radiation dose for each image will be approximately 145 millirads (mrad) for a standard size breast (4.2 cm compressed breast thickness). Conventional: conventional (2D) imaging (standard mammography)

group.title: Tomosynthesis Alone First Then Conventional+Tomo 1 mo. Later
group.description: Tomosynthesis: The mean glandular radiation dose for each image will be approximately 145 millirads (mrad) for a standard size breast (4.2 cm compressed breast thickness). Conventional: conventional (2D) imaging (standard mammography)

measure.title: Detection of Breast Cancer (Sensitivity)
measure.description: Sensitivity is the number of true positives (TP) divided by the sum of TP and false negatives (FN): Sensitivity = TP / (TP+FN)
measure.population: PI left institution in 2012; Data remaining did not include outcome measure and adverse event data. Institution contacted PI on numerous occasions. PI also does not have data.

group.title: All Study Participants

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: PI left institution in 2012; Data remaining did not include outcome measure and adverse event data. Institution contacted PI on numerous occasions. PI also does not have data.
